Name: Promil Bhardwaj
Position: Senior UX Engineer | Google
Data: My team atGoogleis hiring for multiple positions for UI/UX engineers in India.  As a horizontal team that works on Consumer portfolio of Google products you would find yourself working in products like Google Search, Google Flights, Hotels, gPay and commerce products in this role.Our team's focus is frontend development, accessibility of our products (think dark mode, keyboard usability, screen reader navigation etc), prototyping new UI/UX solutions for next generation of product and ideas.What are we looking for:  Folks with solid knowledge of native JS, understanding of HTML semantics, CSS, layout, animations, browser apis, DOM manipulation, performance considerations and a mindset to put users first.  Knowledge of React, Flutter, native app development is a plus but not mandatory.So if you think you have a pretty solid grip on frontend basics (not React, jQuery, Angular etc), please fill in the form below.  Will add it in comments too.https://lnkd.in/dvCZKT5P#google#hiring#frontend#ux#css#team#js#ui#react#flutter#india

Data: We are hiring Flutter Developers for one of our fast-growing projects.#JD:Position: Mobile application development (Flutter)Required Skills:Must be fluent in handling stateless and stateful widgets.Must be comfortable with flutters pub package manager.Must be comfortable with any one of the state management packages (Provider, dio, redux, etc), Experienced in provider is an added advantage.Must be experienced in any one of the version control systems (git, Github, bitbucket, etc).Must be experienced in any one of the software design patterns (MVC, MVVC, etc).Must be comfortable with working agile.Must be comfortable with animation controllers and animation-related widgets.Must be comfortable with creating a custom plugin in flutter (If developed one its is added advantage )If had prior experience in working with the tflite plugin is added advantage.If you previously had an experience in machine learning it is an added advantage.Must have experience in developing apps for an ios devices.Must be comfortable in using the ADB tools and writing unit tests for the app built.Must be able to convert any UI/UX design to a flutter app.Must be experienced in firebase services (starting from RDBS till fire analytics).Must be comfortable with file management for both android and IOS.Must be comfortable in integrating the Social media SSO functionalities in the application.Count: 2#Experience: 1-2 years#Location: Chennai#Pay: Decent hike over the last drawn salary#Notice: Immediate joining or notice up to 30 days#Jobtype: Full timeInterested candidates can drop their updated CVs and queries atmahiba.r@ticvic.com.#ticvic#hiring#development#mobileappdeveloper#flutterdeveloper#flutterjobs

Name: Michalina Jendrzejczyk (葉秋焱)
Position: International Business Development | Asian markets | Research & Consulting | PMP® | Project Management | Mental Health Advocate 💚🎗
Data: I have never before taken the floor at LinkedIn to get personal. This time I will make an exception to that rule as I would like to share with you a story.A story that's of the utmost importance for me. It simply means a lot.So let me make a twist and start from the end.During the past few months, I have:🔸  Obtained the PMP® certification;🔸  Passed the AgilePM Foundation and the AgilePM Practitioner exams;🔸  Passed the Change Management Foundation and the Change Management Practitioner exams;🔸  Taken courses from the Interaction Design Foundation: Become a UX Designer from Scratch; User Experience: The Beginner’s Guide and Journey Mapping🔸  Wrote a 500 pages’ journal on personal experience and growth;🔸  Travelled, mostly solo, to 10+ countries;🔸  Learned Spanish on a conversational level.But before all that was accomplished there was a lot of dark days, pain and anxiety.A picture that was more black and grey than rosy. A picture, on which the smile was nothing more than a mask I had to put on every single day.If you would like to know what happened before the picture below was taken, I sincerely invite you to read my article.On the other hand, if the happy expression captured on the photo below annoys you already, then simply keep scrolling. We need more positivity in the world.#mentalhealth#depression#anxiety#wellbeing#sabbatical#timeoff#priorities#workculture#worklifebalance#progress#goals#growth#experiences#values#motivation#careerbreak#change#achievements
